question.title: Spring Cloud Gateway not routing requests to my microservice
question.body:
I was following a tutorial that shows this application.properties for gateway configuration:

server.port=9000
spring.application.name=UserMS
spring.cloud.gateway.routes[0].id=UserMS
spring.cloud.gateway.routes[0].uri=http://localhost:8080
spring.cloud.gateway.routes[0].predicates[0]=Path=/user/**

but when go to Postman and send a request to: http://localhost:9000/user/register an error ocurred:

    "message": "No static resource user/register for request `'http://localhost:9000/user/register'.",`

Looks like the gateway "not found" the route

Dependencies that I am using:

<dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
      <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-gateway-server-webflux</artifactId>
    </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-devtools</artifactId>
            <scope>runtime</scope>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>io.projectreactor</groupId>
            <artifactId>reactor-test</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>

answers.body:
Your Gateway is not routing because you used the wrong dependency. This dependency:

spring-cloud-starter-gateway-server-webflux

does not enable Spring Cloud Gateway routing, so Spring treats the request like a normal WebFlux app and looks for a static file. That’s why you get:

Code

No static resource user/register

Use the correct dependency:

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-gateway</artifactId>
</dependency>

After replacing it, your route configuration will work and:

Code

http://localhost:9000/user/register

will correctly forward to:

Code

http://localhost:8080/user/register

That’s the whole issue — wrong starter, so routing never activated.
